derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French oignon, based on Latin unio(n-), denoting a kind of onion

entry.def: An onion is a round vegetable with a brown skin that grows underground. It has many white layers on its inside which have a strong, sharp smell and taste.

example.ex: Will you chop an onion up for me?...
example.tran: 你能帮我把一个洋葱切碎吗？

example.ex: It is made with fresh minced meat, cooked with onion and a rich tomato sauce.
example.tran: 这道菜用鲜肉沫加洋葱和浓郁的番茄酱做成。

means.word_mean: 1. edible bulb of an onion plant
2. bulbous plant having hollow leaves cultivated worldwide for its rounded edible bulb
